Reviews.Title: “A decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeroen_K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel as part of a student tour group. As with other hotels on this tour, the exterior and the lobby were nicer than the rooms. Nevertheless, if you can get past the quirky decor (the colours of the room were like pastel breath mints), the rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathroom in particular had had a recent renovation. The desk staff were extremely friendly, helpful and colourful. The breakfast provided was adequate, the coffee excellent. All in all, the Pergola is good basic accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Like a time capsule back to the '60s!”
Reviews.Author: rir_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were comfortable, but very small and somewhat cramped; pretty typical for a large European city. Service was good, but the whole hotel seems to be frozen in time: from the orange front counter to the round circular chairs in the breakfast room, to the servers wearing tuxedo vests and bow ties! It was a bit bizarre, but the stay was restful.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel in residential area, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MichalM12
Reviews.Content: A city hotel in a residential area of Rome. The rooms are spacious however, the loo is so close to the shower that it's a good thing i am only 1.62cm (5.2"). The hotel is doing some construction work in its garden so - ask how far along they are before you reserve. However, all mmebers of staff are incredibly friendly. I asked for a quieter room (construction work begins at 7:00) and all they asked was for me to pack my things, when I returned I found they moved me to a larger and, indeed quieter, room. In this room there was no shower but a bathtub and the bathroom was very spacious. There's wifi in the room - ask reception for the PW. Breakfast is very italian - mostly pastry (a good selection) but also cereals . Two machines provide for all your coffee needs. Beware though than the orange juice (regular oranges and blood oranges) is rather an orange drink and I doubt it has ever seen real oranges. Busses into the centre and to the Termini train station are around the corner. A lovely, typica restaurant is across the road -Pizzando Grigliando which offers great Pizza but also great grille meat (don't miss the lambchops)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great for our Educational Tour Group of HS kids/parents.”
Reviews.Author: KJR4
Reviews.Content: Sergio at the front Desk was ever so helpful and patient with us! Great rooms, great location and a WONDERFUL BREAKFAST for us each morning we were there in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “week in rome”
Reviews.Author: aaron1963
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife at the La Pergola hotel for 5 nights during our stay in Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful. Some reviewers commented on the rooms small. I thing room are typicaly european size. Room was clean, linen changed regularly and towels changed daily nice breakfast room. Breakfast in the morning was varied and plentiful was cereals, yoghurts, fruit and masses of cakes and croissants Staff were very friendly and helpful free interner conner in the lobby and free wi fi in the room There is a really good restaurant on the opposite side of the road "Pizzando e Grigliando" The hotel is 15-20 minutes (depending on what time of day you travel) by bus into the centre of Rome bus 80 express line take you in Piazza Venezia and 38 take you at the main Station. We enjoyed our stay at la Pergola hotel and we would definitely go back there

Reviews.Title: “miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: imkes003
Reviews.Content: My daughter spent several days at the Hotel La Pergola as part of a school trip. She had a very bad experience at this hotel: 1. My daughter was advised to leave valuables with the receptionist, so she left the Bose headset that I had lend her with them. When she wanted to pick it up the headset had disappeared and no one claimed responsibility. I tried to contact them but they nevery replied. 2. There was blood in side my daughter's hotel room and one of the towels was bloody; the hotel refused to change it. As a result two girls had to share one towel. My advise, don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommend”
Reviews.Author: ynu
Reviews.Content: 45 minutes bus from Termini, too far away for any place of interest. the breakfast made me sick for half day. can hear next room talking. the "shuttle service" hotel provided is only a carpool which charged much more than airport taxi. and he charged the tips himself. driving almost 200 km/hr without seat belt on. Crazy~~ but, customer service is ok. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, very functional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugPetawawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 12 euro cab ride from down town or an hour by bus during rush hour. Very functional atmosphere, accustomed to groups. Internet available in the lobby, hours are limited and end at 10:30 p.m. On check in concierge was clear about noise, breakfast hours, etc. Rooms were small, beds pretty hard and small. Bathroom functional and clean. Hairdryer in bathroom. Breakfast fresh, but rather plain, bread, buns, danishes, butter, jam, juice, coffee. Staff in the breakfast room rarely even gave anyone a second look, just went about their work and talked to each other. Grocery store and selection of cheap to expensive restaurants nearby. Grocery store was a neat adventure to see all of the different products, including pastas, oils, vinegars, wines, fruits, etc. Bakery and coffee shop up the street tot he right that came alive in the evening with locals. This hotel has a lovely little garden sheltered from the busy main street. When I checked on-line, I though it had a pool, but I couldn't find one. In any case, clean hote, friendly desk staff, okay breakfast. Nice enough spot and fairly quiet at night in spite of being on the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel without surprises.”
Reviews.Author: canuckshutterbug
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with a few quirks, but it's still run decently, it's comfortable and the staff are really quite friendly. We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour and found it a bit strange, but our stay ended up being comfortable and uneventful. The walls are a bit thin, so you'll likely hear activity in other rooms, but the rooms are large enough and the bathrooms were in fairly good repair. No nasty surprises, so we were satisfied. The hotel staff were definitely very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Eurofriends
Reviews.Content: We were part of a Trafalgar European tour group (cost-saver). We stayed at this hotel 2 nights and really spent minimal time in the room/hotel – after all we were in Europe to sightsee! Hotel’s positives - free internet - rooms were an OK size - breakfast was OK, there was cereal, pastries, juice and coffee - supermarket next-door - nice garden Hotel’s negatives - beds were lumpy and short (even for average sized people) - bathroom was tiny and the toilet was on a slant and underneath a ledge (you’d almost fall off it) - pipes made strange noises - the shower was a little smelly - supermarket next door - too far from the city

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get past the odour.”
Reviews.Author: scliffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for several nights on a tour in May. There were several other group tours there, mainly american school tours. Our room, on the first floor, was very small, dark and quite noisy. It was crowded with furniture and was not clean. The bed linen was fine, but the blanket and cover both needed a good wash. The shower was adequate, but also undersize. The breakfast room was very pleasant and the breakfast good. What made the whole stay dreadful for us was the awful smell to the room, which, we believe, emanated from the rubbish bins outside and from the pipes within the bathroom. We were told by management that the hotel was full and there was no possibility of changing rooms. They were definitely hostile in their attitude. The supermarket next door was excellent and there were banks and other facilities all near, which was good, as this hotel is some way from the centre. We were very relieved to move on. I have stayed in much better places in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hanhanhan
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel for four nights, location wasnt so good a little far from the city center. but there is bus stop near the hotel so you can easily go where ever you want. our room was the smallest hotel room i have ever seen but it was nice and clean. and there is mcdonalds, upim and a supermarket next to the hotel that was nice for us.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wwediva619
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few days in March with a large tour group. I thought the area was beautiful and there were places to go around it and it also wasn't as far from the cities as the other hotels we stayed at... I like how it was decorated and I thought they were well accommodating. I would highly recommend it. The garden I thought was very beautiful especially late night/early morning. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was it's showers.... they were way too small and the other ones that were in the hotel just covered the whole bathroom floor, i guess that's not too bad but a lot of the hotels we stayed at in Italy had really small showers but huge bathrooms. I definately recommend this hotel though...

Reviews.Title: “This was a nice hotel - I disagree with previous ratings”
Reviews.Author: ohlatxnc
Reviews.Content: I profoundly disagree with the earlier ratings for this hotel. It may be possible that two different hotels exist in Rome with the same name. The Hotel La Pergola that I stayed in was nice (address: Via Dei Prati Fiscali 55, Roma 00141, Italy, phone #+39 06 810 7250, ---). The staff was friendly, helpful, and certainly went out of their way to accommodate our large tour group. One of the hotel managers, Sergio, was especially helpful, and made our stay pleasant. The hotel is located next to a grocery store and a Mc Donald's (aka American embassy). It was a short, safe walk and several of our tour members visited one or both locations. The outside of the hotel is fine. There is a very nice courtyard in an "L" shape and many in my group really enjoyed sitting there. I found the rooms adequate. My only complaint is that the walls were thin - I could hear my neighbors in the next room talking (glad I brought my earplugs). Otherwise, the room was clean and comfortable, with no odors as described in previous ratings. I had the occasion to enter several of the hotel's rooms since I was a chaperone on our tour group, and I also found the same clean, odor free conditions in those rooms as well (of course it was clean before the kids opened their suitcases!). The hotel arrangements were made for my group by EF Tours. I do not know what the room cost, but I expect that it was a reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “quit your compaining”
Reviews.Author: sallyrose14
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a little further out from Rome then i expected, but it was easy to get in and out of the city center. I actually liked the location towards the end because my children couldn't get into trouble. perfectly clean and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “La Pergola not your best bet”
Reviews.Author: Italychaperone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was every bit as bad as the previous reviews indicated. The rooms are small, uncomfortable and many had the smell of sewage coming up from the shower drains. We had five kids stuffed into tiny top floor rooms and I did not see any smoke alarms. The desk clerk is as smarmy a character as I have met. One room with five girls had only 4 towels and he said he did not have a key to get another towel. When we protested, he pulled a roll of toilet tissue from beneath the desk and said, "This is what I have to blow my nose on and you want a towel?" That probably was the roll missing from one of the rooms. One chaperone had no pillow at all and was told there was not another one in the hotel. The hotel is in a poor location, very far from any sightseeing. The ladies in the breakfast room are friendly and will get you a real cup of coffee if you tip a Euro or two. I would never, never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Thievery, Trashy ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel was terrible, with the exception of beautiful balconys and views. Rooms are miniscule, dirty, uncleaned, and vile. Any room on the ground floor is basically out of luck. My room had a door connecting to the lobby!! For the shower there was just a drain in the ground, no covering or even a botton to the shower, just a drain, rather hole in the floor. lightbulbs in bathroom never worked. be sure to lock your luggage and keep all items inside your luggage when leaving the room for the day. articles of clothing always went missing and astray. If you do decide to stay check under your mattresses and behind all furniture. They hide clothing so you cant find it and then when you leave the hotel the take the clothes because it isn't technically "stealing" persay. DO NOT STAY HERE! service is extremely rude, unapproachable, and unhelpful, and disrespectful. overall terrible hotel that steals!

Reviews.Title: “What the @&^!”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnnLeftCoast
Reviews.Content: First day my tour group was there, four people got stuck in the elevator with their carry-ons. My friends and I(5 people) were stuffed into a room with two twin beds, three cots and four pillows. Our shower shared the same floor as our leaky toilet ,which ran all night like a Jerry Lewis tele-thon. The lights in some rooms flicker for minutes on end before stabilizing. (maybe its a European thing, or maybe its a sign of a death trap). My friend was accused of breaking the circa 1964 desktop computer which was riddled with porn and viruses of alll kinds. We shared a room that connected to a community room that had sliding glass doors that didnt lock and was hidden by a curtain on the inside of our room. The only good thing about this place is that if you miss home, there's a McDonald's just next door, right next to the liquor store and gun store. Felt more like the 9th ward in N.O. than Rome. Do yourself a favor, DONT DO IT!! For the money you spend, pitch in another 60 Euros a night and go somewhere much better. I've seen better days in a Motel Six, at least the light will stay on.

Reviews.Title: “seen worse, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Typical small room - get used to it. Hinges on armoire were broken. Shower curtain smelled. Late at night heard screams in the next room. Through the walls heard voices of 2 women yelling about a big bug on the bed. Breakfast = day old crossants and coffee. After a student tour left, the breakfast added yogurt, juice and fresh rolls and crossants.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: JamesDeVries
Reviews.Content: Try to beat this bad experience. My group and I took a tour through the Roman sites one day and returned to our hotel to find that the maids had gone through our luggage and hid one article of clothing from 14 different students. The maids had removed the blouses, skirts, pants, etc. and placed them BEHIND the armoir, under the matress, etc. in hopes of us leaving them behind on our next day's departure. When I confronted the hotel manager/owner, he unapologetically informed me that the maid has two small children to take care of and it was "probably a joke your students are playing on you." Of course, I was shocked. As far as the hotel is concnerend, the "internet site" was never working. They couldn't seem to manage to give me an extra pillow in my room "NO, only one pillow per room." The pillow was as thick as cardboard. The rooms were so tiny that I could reach across the room and touch the other side with my feet (granted, I'm 6'3 but it's still no excuse.) The hotel is nowhere close to any of the major sites. This is totally a hassle when you're tired from seeing the sites for the day and all you want is a little refresher at a hotel before going out again. Did I mention that my room didn't have air conditioning???? Please, take it from an honest teacher, don't stay in this hotel. If anyone out there has any good suggestions for hotels that can accomodate large groups in Rome, please send me a note.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought that this was an incredible hotel. I stayed with a group, and although we were a bit cramped, the balcony and staff made up for it. I'm planning another trip for this summer and am quite excited to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pergola in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the Pergola a wonderful place and conventient to the sights by bus.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: extremely bad hotel....really really bad. Rude unhelpful staff, small and dirty rooms. Even the local taxi cab drivers tell tourists how bad the hotel is...stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated La Pergola”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am usually pretty tolerant when it comes to hotels, because I have had to stay in some poor conditions, but this was beyond terrible. I was with a group, and some rooms smelled, beds were crammed into them, and some of the employees were just plain rude. When a member of my group asked for new sheets because his were dirty, he was told that if clean sheets couldn't be found, he would have to sleep without sheets. One room had five beds crammed into it, and five of our gentlemen had to sleep in there, almos ton top of one another. It was ridiculous. Because we were young, we were kicked out of a sitting area... for playing chess, the quietest game ever! Breakfast was absolutely nothing to write home about, either. The only things it can boast are the free internet access and the fact that there is a McDonald's in the shopping center next door. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, and you will seriously regret choosing this as a place to sleep while in Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Pergola
HotelInfo.Address: Via Pratti Fiscali 55, 00141 Rome, Italy
